thread.title: Jose Mourinho plays down Eric Bailly injury concerns after defender limps out of Man United U23s game
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho plays down Eric Bailly injury concerns after defender limps out of Man United U23s game

author: Liam Corless
title: Jose Mourinho plays down Eric Bailly injury concerns after defender limps out of Man United U23s game

organizations.name: getty images) share get manchester united fc

text:
Sport Jose Mourinho plays down Eric Bailly injury concerns after defender limps out of Man United U23s game Bailly was withdrawn as a precaution after picking up an ankle knock during a reserve team clash against Everton Share Eric Bailly is fit for United's clash with Hull (Photo: Man Utd via Getty Images) Share Get Manchester United FC     
Jose Mourinho has played down concerns surrounding the fitness of Manchester United defender Eric Bailly. 
The Ivorian, 22, limped out of an Under-23s encounter against Everton on Monday night with an ankle problem. 
However, he could be in United's squad for Wednesday night's visit of Hull after Mourinho passed him - and the rest of his squad - fit for the Premier League encounter. 
“We always play a full-strength team," he said. "It depends on the way you look at it but we always try to have a strong team. 
“Of course, we had some players that didn’t play the last match [against Wigan], some players with a lot of matches played already – people like Valencia, Ibra, Pogba. Some of these players with lot of matches didn’t play but will play tomorrow.” Ibrahimovic and Pogba will play against Hull (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
